original: The Gothic style emerged in Hungary during the late 14th century and flourished throughout the reigns of the Anjou, Luxembourg, and Jagelló dynasties. Wealthy mining towns, such as Kassa (modern-day Košice, Slovakia), Bártfa (Bardejov, Slovakia), Brassó (Brașov, Romania), and Nagyszeben (Sibiu, Romania), constructed their main squares in this architectural style. This influence is also evident in several renovated monasteries, including
